Hello all, I live in a very small rural village in Auvergne (France) and I am producer of goat cheese! when I keep my goats I have the pleasure of taking pictures ...﻿
Meer weergevenMinder weergeven · Vertalen

France
"Salers cheese
From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia
Salers Country of origin: France Region, town: Auvergne, Salers Source of milk: Cow Pasteurised: No Texture: Semi-hard Aging time: 9 months Certification: French AOC 1961
Salers (French: Le Salers) is a French semi-hard cheese from the volcanic region in the mountains of Auvergne, central France. It is a pressed, uncooked cheese made from Salers cow's milk between the 15 April and 15 November. It is similar to Cantal cheese - which is produced from the same cows' milk when they are fed on hay during the remaining months of the year - and has been estimated to have been fabricated in this region for at least 2000 years. It came to prominence when Maréchal de Senneterre served it at the table of Louis XIV of France. Maréchal de Senneterre is also responsible for the introduction of Saint-Nectaire and Cantal. Salers has benefited from the Appellation d'origine contrôlée since 1961.[1] It is best eaten between September and March, after an ageing time of nine months, but it is also excellent all year round. Salers de Buron Traditional is only made up in the chalet (called a 'buron' in the Auvergne) in the summer months with milk exclusively from the Salers cow. It must also be made in the traditional wooden 'gerle'. [2] It is circular in shape, weighing around 40 kg. 1,112 tonnes were produced in 1998 (+15.1% since 1996). All was made in local farms from unpasteurized milk by about one hundred producers."

Really looking forward to Burning Man... Are you part of an interesting camp? I have a few invites... not sure where I will go or if I will just freelance it off in the wild... Either way, I'll be taking lots of photos!
Want to see more Burning Man photos? I've got all the ones I've published so far over at http://www.stuckincustoms.com/category/travel/nevada/burning-man/﻿

The stream sunrise ©SC Pictures Note by SC Pictures: near a creek in Auvergne sunrise, the ground is frozen and the sun is reflected on every blade of grass. When he leaves the horizon, all the scene takes on orange tones, a magical moment, alone in my campaign.﻿
